intro: Corchorus hygrophilus, commonly known as water hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, hibiscus-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near water bodies. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as cotton and hibiscus. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been used in traditional crafts and textiles in some cultures.
